ygData.subject: RE: Pet abilities
ygData.msgSnippet: In the past: You would want to give your pet anything under a 30 attack delay. Anything slower than that would actually slow your pet down, where as FS Dagger
ygData.messageBody:
In the past:
You would want to give your pet anything under a 30 attack delay. Anything
slower than that would actually slow your pet down, where as FS Dagger with
a delay of 19 would make your pet hit more often. As a side note, your pet
would hit for maximum damage of what he is capable of, no matter what the
damage rating of the weapon was.

Now:
Neither delay nor damage does anything beneficial, but you need to give your
pet 2 weapons of ANY kind so he will get the correct double attacks.

Manbik Prodo'Lues
Gnome Necromancer (Tunare)

-----Original Message-----
From: Nat Russo [mailto:nrusso@...]
Sent: Monday, February 14, 2000 12:22 PM
To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [EQ_Necromancer] Pet abilities


From: "Nat Russo" <nrusso@...>

Great site! Thanks for the link. I've just begun to peruse all of the
information they have there. I'm sure it will take me a while :)

I do have another question (probably an ignorant one :( ) based on
information I'm reading at EQNecro. Some of the posts talk about "the
recent Delay nerf". What nerf is that? I'm operating on the assumption
that it's a good thing to give my pet a weapon with a delay of less than
30...regardless of the damage base. Is this true? Or has this so-called
"delay nerf" changed that?

Thanks again,
Mujahid 15 Necro Sol Ro
